topic.fullpath: Topic :: Formats and Protocols :: Protocols :: Web Services

name: SuStorID
short_description: SuStorID is an advanced Intrusion Detection System (IDS) for web services, based on machine learning. Its name comes from the term “Su Stori”, which in Sardinian language means “The Falcon”. It’s version is experimental, but demonstrates a number of interesting features, that can be readily exploited to detect and act against web attacks. SuStorID can be coupled with modsecurity, the well known web application firewall, to gather training data and provide for real-time counteractions. So, SuStorID is a host-based Intrusion Detection System, and by means of modsecurity can access internal web server’s data (i.e. http request/response fields) exactly as Apache does.
